name: Stillbirth
title: Stillbirth
purpose:
(Clinical Focus: This value set focuses on capturing information about fetal death occurring at or after 20 weeks gestation, but before complete expulsion or complete delivery. It aims to provide a standardized approach to documenting stillbirth cases in electronic health records and vital statistics reporting.),(Data Element Scope: This value set defines concepts related to stillbirth within the context of pregnancy outcomes. It captures details beyond a simple "stillbirth" indicator, allowing for a more nuanced understanding of each case.),(Inclusion Criteria: The value set includes the general concept of "stillbirth" and specific terms for single stillbirth and various scenarios involving multiple births (twins, triplets, etc.) with some or all fetuses being stillborn.
Codes are included to capture details about the gestational age at stillbirth (premature, term, immature, mature).
Fetal sex (male, female, undetermined) is included when known.
The timing of fetal death is specified (antepartum - before labor, or unknown timing).
The type of twins (fraternal or identical) is included for multiple births.),(Exclusion Criteria: This value set excludes information about the cause of stillbirth.
It does not capture details about pregnancy complications, management, or interventions.
Miscarriage (fetal death before 20 weeks) is not included.)

concept.display: Twins, one liveborn and one stillborn

contains.display: Twins, one liveborn and one stillborn
